result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquis D. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to any other sentence.
Huber & Work Crew allowed.
Court costs & surcharge to be paid during probation in 14CF515.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquis D. Jones

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Don Bielski.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Count 1 - Deft. is sentenced to 5 months in the KCJ forthwith and is consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.  Court costs & surcharge may be paid during probation in 14CF515.  Appeal Rights given.

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Don Bielski.  Clerk: PT
Amended Information filed by the State.  Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Count 1 - Deft. pleads Guilty as amended; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 1/28/15 at 11:30 AM.
